answers.answer: Hi, Thank you for your question. From the symptoms you describe, it sounds that it could be a circulatory disturbance (due to compression of blood vessels) or a nerve pinched.  Besides it may also occur due  pre-menopausal state, any clots in blood vessels, excessive alcohol use or diabetes. I would suggest evaluating all the possibilities with the help of a doctor first. Further referral to a neurologist will surely help you in getting a more precise opinion here. Hope this information proves help you.

question: Hi, I have had numbness in my feet and mostly hands, coming and going for about a year now.  I have high blood pressure and cholesterol, both of which I am taking medicine for.  I am also pre-menopausal.  Today it is extemely discomforting.  I have been sleeping with wrist braces, and I've wondered if when I have salty foods I seem to notice it more.  Could that possibly be something that induces it?  Oddly there is also a spot on my lower neck that hurts when I touch it, along with a stiff neck.  Can anyone offer some insight or home remedies?
title: Ongoing numbness in hands and feet
